definition: to digress/to stray from the topic
to run/to run away/to escape/to run around (on errands etc)/(of a gas or liquid) to leak or evaporate/(verb complement) away/off
topic/problem for discussion/exam question/subject/to inscribe/to mention/CL:個|个[ge4],道[dao4]

sentences.english: Let me just finish this digression.
sentences.chinese: 讓我趕緊結束這次跑題。

sentences.english: I love eating Crab, and I love the sea.
sentences.chinese: 呵呵，有點跑題，從喫蟹跑到看海了。

sentences.english: He digressed so often that it was hard to follow what he was saying.
sentences.chinese: 他時常跑題，所以很難聽明白他想表達什麼。

sentences.english: Figure out when are you most susceptible to blabbing on.
sentences.chinese: 找出你在什麼時候最有可能跑題？

sentences.english: Let me go into another litter digression.
He wandered off, sipping the last of his latte.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着嚥下最後一口咖啡，他跑題了。

sentences.english: You'll also learn innovative ways to prevent callers from wandering off the topic, and who calls back if you're disconnected;
sentences.chinese: 同時學習用創新的方式防止呼叫者跑題和電話吊線。

sentences.english: Student: I think slightly carried away.
A： Excuse me for interrupting, but you are missing the point.
sentences.chinese: 請原諒我插嘴，你跑題了。

sentences.english: By doing this, you take away attention from the problem at hand.
sentences.chinese: 這樣做，你就把注意力從該說的事兒本身講跑題兒了。
